STEP.INSTRUCTIONS: Make sure that the possible fault diagnosis and required works listed in the aircraft inspection documents have been carried out
Check the visual aspect of skins, paint and riveting

COMMENTS.COMMENT: An unreported bump in a composite panel must be dealt with by a specific inspection to check for delamination

STEP.INSTRUCTIONS: Check attachment of panels, doors, fairings and antennas
Check condition of pipes and hoses, couplings, electrical cables, bonding braids and safetying devices
Check connection and locking of electrical connectors, visually
Check no oil, fuel, hydraulic fluid or coolanol leaks
Check overall condition of external stores, no shock mark or distortion (shake the external stores by hand to check correct attachment)

COMMENTS.COMMENT: Ask an armament operator to intervene in case a defect is noticed or if in doubt about external store integrity

STEP.INSTRUCTIONS: Open the GRP door
Set the FLT DISP RFL selector switch to DISP, then check that the APU indicator light goes out after 5 sec

COMMENTS.COMMENT: The fuel indicator lights are on when the fuel tanks are full and the ancillary system lights are out

STEP.INSTRUCTIONS: Perform a lamp test, then check that all the indicator lights go out

COMMENTS.COMMENT: Top up the relevant systems when indicator lights remain on

STEP.INSTRUCTIONS: Put the rotary switch on MR
Put the selector FLT DISP RFL on RFL and the rotary switch on MBAT
Wait for 30s then check the indicated voltage minimum of 24,4V if external temperature is ≥ 0°C, and 23,5V if external temperature is ≤ 0°C

COMMENTS.COMMENT: These voltage are only to be taken into account if the battery was not activated from at least 3 hours

STEP.INSTRUCTIONS: Replace the battery if it's voltage is lower than the minimum required
Put the selector FLT DISP RFL on DISP and rotactor on UBAT
Check the indicated voltage - must be 24,7V ± 0,2V
Replace the battery if it's voltage is lower than the minimum required
Set the FLT DISP RFL selector switch to FLT
Close the GRP door
Check overall aspect of skin (riveting and hardware)
Check overall condition of nose fairing and of the radomes
Check overall condition of FSO and FMA top antenna
Check overall condition of FMA bottom antenna
Check overall condition of right LWD and formation light
Check overall condition of left LWD and formation light
Check cleanliness of windows
Check general condition of inflight refueling probe; in the event a defect is noticed, perform a visual inspection of the inflight refueling probe assembly
Check skin, with the doors closed and locked
Check condition of mobile multifunction probes on the right side, making sure that holes are not blocked (do not set them to max deflection)

COMMENTS.COMMENT: Handle the multifunction probe vane by holding the pitot probe located at its end so as to avoid distorting it

STEP.INSTRUCTIONS: Check condition of mobile multifunction probes on the left side, making sure that holes are not blocked (do not set them to max deflection)

COMMENTS.COMMENT: Handle the multifunction probe vane by holding the pitot probe located at its end so as to avoid distorting it

STEP.INSTRUCTIONS: Check for electrolyte traces at the main battery ventilation ports

STEP.TITLE: Nose U/C and nose wheel well inspection

STEP.INSTRUCTIONS: Open the front nose U/C door
Check condition of U/C door, side doors and control linkages
Check presence and good condition of U/C door stops
Check correct opening of U/C hooking mechanism
Check good condition and free rotation of U/C and U/C door olive fittings
Check overall condition of U/C wheel well layout
Check no distortion, cut and shock mark on pipes, wiring, connectors and equipment
Check that the operating pressure of the parking brake accumulator is 110 bar
If required, use the hand-actuated pump to restore the correct pressure

COMMENTS.COMMENT: The nitrogen inflation residual pressure is 60 bar minimum

STEP.INSTRUCTIONS: Check the nose undercarriage
Close the front nose U/C door
Check the condition of the tyres
Check the wheel inflation

STEP.TITLE: RH air intake inspection (frames C.17 to C.27)

STEP.INSTRUCTIONS: Check overall aspect of skin (riveting and hardware)
Check general condition of boundary layer bleed and absence of foreign matter
Check aspect and attachment of RFA, damage indicator paint not visible
Check condition and deflection of additional air intake side door and presence of rubber stops
Check condition and presence of mouth and side foam discs if gun installed and DAMOCLES pod not installed
Check condition and presence of mouth and side metal discs if gun not installed
Check absence of mouth and side discs if gun and DAMOCLES pod installed
Check condition of glass cover of lower anti-collision light
Check overall condition of canard and surrounding area (lower surface, leading edge, LERX)
Check closing of gun barrel removal doors and condition of ventilation scoops
Check closing of FCS and right ground crew panel doors

COMMENTS.COMMENT: If the doors are open, set the switches to FLT before closing the doors

STEP.TITLE: Right engine air duct and front section

COMMENTS.COMMENT: Make sure that clothes and shoes (no grazing parts) will not damage the skin before entering the duct

STEP.INSTRUCTIONS: Check for impacts on air intake sharp leading edge
Check for missing rivet heads and loosened screws
Check for impacts on the skin
Check for fuel leaks
Check for condition of temperature sensor (at 12 o'clock position)
Inspect the engine front area
Exit the air duct while making sure that there is no foreign matter

STEP.TITLE: Inspection of RH lower fuselage (frames C.27 to C.41)

STEP.INSTRUCTIONS: Check the overall aspect of fuselage skin, riveting, hardware and check for leaks (in particular at the RH accessory gearbox drain ports)
Check the closing of the gun door
Check that C2 accumulator pressure ≥ 140 bar

STEP.TITLE: RH main U/C and wheel well inspection

STEP.INSTRUCTIONS: Open the main U/C door
Check condition of U/C door
Check presence and good condition of U/C door stop
Check good condition and free rotation of U/C and U/C door olive fittings
Check correct opening of U/C hooking mechanism
Check overall condition of U/C wheel well layout
Check no distortion, cut and shock mark on pipes, wiring, connectors and equipment
Check condition and attachment of electrical master box and utility battery
Check locking of ammunition box
Check condition and closing of parallelogram hinged structure isolation doors
Check condition of shield door and its rod and presence of pin
Check the RH main U/C
Close the U/C door (1 lock)
Check height of shock absorber
Check the tyre condition
Check the tyre pressure

COMMENTS.COMMENT: Make sure that the brakes have cooled down enough before starting any maintenance operations on them (risks of severe burns)

STEP.INSTRUCTIONS: Actuate the wear indicators to make sure that the thrust plate is not stuck
Press on the wear indicators to take up the thrust plate play

COMMENTS.COMMENT: The limit is reached when the indicator is flush with the reference surface (parking brake aplied or released)

STEP.TITLE: RH wing inspection (lower surface and external stores)

STEP.INSTRUCTIONS: Check good condition of navigation light transparent panel
Check overall aspect of skin (riveting and hardware, doors and fairings)
Check condition of slat leading edge
Check condition of wing tip missile launcher lights
Check condition of elevons
Check no hydraulic fluid and fuel leaks
Check overall condition of store carrying devices and external stores installed under the wing

COMMENTS.COMMENT: Also check locking of external stores, that there is no leaks, no distortions, etc.

STEP.INSTRUCTIONS: Correct closing and locking of suction defuelling and filler plugs (wing and external tanks)

STEP.TITLE: Inspection of RH lower fuselage (frames C.27 to C.41) (cont'd)

STEP.INSTRUCTIONS: Make sure that the air-fuel heat exchanger scoop is not distorted and contains no foreign matters when it is open
Make sure that the alternator cooling scoop is not distorted and contains no foreign matters
Check overall condition of lateral store station missile and missile launcher
Check overall condition of store carrying devices and external stores installed under the fuselage

COMMENTS.COMMENT: Also check locking of external stores, that there is no leaks, no distortions, etc.

STEP.INSTRUCTIONS: Check correct closing and locking of suction defuelling and filler plugs (fuselage and external tanks)
Check that the safety pin is installed
Check that the actuator pressure is equal to 198 bar at 20 °C
Check the engine rear section and exhaust duct
While standing on the ground, check general aspect of skin
While standing on the ground, check condition of trailing edge and rudder
While standing on the ground, check condition of navigation light
While standing on the ground, check no fuel, hydraulic fluid and coolanol leaks

STEP.TITLE: Inspection of LH lower fuselage (frames C.27 to C.41)

STEP.INSTRUCTIONS: Check overall aspect of fuselage skin, riveting, hardware and check for leaks (in particular at the LH accessory gearbox drain ports)
From the outside, the engine rear section and exhaust duct for burns, distortions and impacts
Overall condition of lateral store station missile and missile launcher
Check overall condition of store carrying devices and external stores installed under the fuselage

COMMENTS.COMMENT: Also check locking of external stores, that there is no leaks, no distortions, etc.

STEP.INSTRUCTIONS: Check correct closing and locking of suction defuelling and filler plugs (fuselage and external tanks)
Make sure that the alternator cooling scoop is not distorted and contains no foreign matters
Make sure the air-fuel heat exchanger scoop is not distorted and contains no foreign matters when it is open

STEP.TITLE: LH wing inspection (lower surface and external stores)

STEP.INSTRUCTIONS: Check overall aspect of skin (riveting and hardware, doors and fairings)
Check condition of elevons
Check condition of wing tip missile launcher lights
Check condition of slat leading edge
Check good condition of navigation light and searchlight transparent panels
Check no hydraulic fluid and fuel leaks
Check overall condition of store carrying devices and external stores installed under the wing

COMMENTS.COMMENT: Also check locking of external stores, that there is no leaks, no distortions, etc.

STEP.INSTRUCTIONS: Check correct closing and locking of suction defuelling and filler plugs (wing and external tanks)

STEP.TITLE: LH main U/C and wheel well inspection

STEP.INSTRUCTIONS: Open the main U/C door
Check condition of U/C door
Check presence and good condition of U/C door stop
Check good condition and free rotation of U/C and U/C door olive fittings
Check correct opening of U/C hooking mechanism
Check overall condition of U/C wheel well layout
Check no distortion, cut and shock mark on pipes, wiring, connectors and equipment
Check condition and attachment of electrical master box and U/C-U/C door system control unit
Check C1 accumulator pressure ≥ 140 bar
Check condition of shield door and its rod and presence of pin
Check the LH main U/C
Close the U/C door (1 lock)
Check height of shock absorber
Check the tyre condition
Check the tyre pressure

COMMENTS.COMMENT: Make sure that the brakes have cooled down enough before starting any maintenance operations on them (risks of severe burns)

STEP.INSTRUCTIONS: Actuate the wear indicators to make sure that the thrust plate is not stuck
Press on the wear indicators to take up the thrust plate play

COMMENTS.COMMENT: The limit is reached when the indicator is flush with the reference surface (parking brake aplied or released)

STEP.TITLE: LH air intake inspection (frames C.17 to C.27)

STEP.INSTRUCTIONS: Check that the removable memory cartridge is installed in the DSU box
Check the light filaments
Check overall aspect of skin (riveting and hardware)
Check general condition of boundary layer bleed and absence of foreign matter
Check aspect and attachment of RFA, damage indicator paint not visible
Check condition and deflection of additional air intake side door and presence of the rubber stops
Check overall condition of canard and surrounding area (lower surface, leading edge, LERX)

STEP.TITLE: Left engine air duct and front section

COMMENTS.COMMENT: Make sure that clothes and shoes (no grazing parts) will not damage the skin before entering the duct

STEP.INSTRUCTIONS: Check for impacts on air intake sharp leading edge
Check for missing rivet heads and losened scrrews
Check for impacts on the skin
Check for fuel leaks
Check the condition of temperature sensor (at 12 o'clock position)
Inspect the engine front area
Exit the air duct while making sure that there is no foreign matter

STEP.TITLE: Inspection of fin and fuselage and wing upper surface

STEP.INSTRUCTIONS: Use the ladder to gain access to the upper section of the aircraft
Check overall aspect of skins, riveting, hardware, door and panel attachment
Check condition of fin top equipment, cleanliness of windows and MWS, and clean them if required
Check condition of formation light
Check condition of cartridge dispenser modules: locking of loaders (yellow mark) and no foreign matters
Check overall condition of rudder
Check that the cooling scoops in the APU area are neither blocked nor distorted
Check that the APU exhaust nozzle is not distorted, bears no mark of burns and contains no foreign matters
Check that the APU bleed valve outlet is neither blocked nor distorted
Check that the fuel heat exchanger air outlets (in fillets) are not distorted and contain no foreign matters
Check that the gun cooling outlet (in fillet) is not distorted and contains no foreign matters
Check correct closing and locking of feeder tank and front tank group filler plugs
Check condition of anti-collision light and antennas
Check that the heat exchanger air outlet is not distorted and contains no foreign matters
Check overall condition of each canard (leading edge in particular) and LERX
Check correct positioning of the canopy in relation to the fuselage
Check no distortion
Check cleanliness of the outer surface of the transparent panels; if not clean them
Check good condition of DACRON hinges and cement chamfers
Check no erosion and no unsticking
Check good condition of canopy-cutting external controls
Check general aspect of the cockpit
Check aspect of detonating cords: overall good condition of cords and bearing surfaces

COMMENTS.COMMENT: If in doubt about possible damage, observe the damage tolerance instructions
